intro: Haplopappus glabratus, commonly known as the smooth pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are usually linear and gray-green, while its small yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Haplopappus glabratus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
